intro: Calophanes setosus, commonly known as the hairy calophane, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Calophanes setosus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
